message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.CL, cs.NE 

The paper proposes a framework for Multi-Class Incremental Learning (MCIL) and conducts experiments on image classification benchmarks, which are typically associated with the sub-categories of machine learning (cs.LG), computer vision (cs.CV), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), natural language processing (cs.CL), and neural and evolutionary computing (cs.NE). However, since the focus is on MCIL, which is a subfield of machine learning, we can reasonably assume that cs.LG is the most likely sub-category. The use of image classification benchmarks also suggests cs.CV as a likely sub-category. The mention of bilevel optimizations and end-to-end training suggests cs.AI and cs.NE as possible sub-categories. Finally, the mention of boundaries between classes suggests cs.CL as a possible sub-category, although it is less likely than the others.
